10d8ce6f-58da-41e9-8a20-ab19ef6c510e.description: Cowley College recognizes the importance of having instructors with proper knowledge in using our LMS. Using Blackboard is beneficial to you and your students in the delivery of online course content. Blackboard is a Learning Management System that allows you to provide content to students in a central location, communicate with students quickly, and provide grades in an electronic format.
10d8ce6f-58da-41e9-8a20-ab19ef6c510e.name: Blackboard Online Qualified

badge_template_activities.title: Introduction to Blackboard Learn

It is important for F2F/Hybrid/Online instructors to know the essentials of Blackboard if/when distance delivery becomes necessary.

3cc96844-22de-4bbb-bf18-ce498f02d4bc.description: This course is designed to allow students to earn a one-year renewable user certification in the use of the Taser 7 device. This course emphasizes both proficiency and decision-making in the use of the Taser 7 device, as well as the current legalities of the use of this device. This course meets all requirements set forth by Axon. This course is part of the curriculum for CRJ5484 Criminal Justice Internship I.
3cc96844-22de-4bbb-bf18-ce498f02d4bc.name: Taser 7 User Certification (8Hrs)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 8- hour Axon Taser classroom course
Completion of Basic Taser user course written exam with a minimum score of 90%
Completion of Taser 7 written exam with a minimum score of 90%
Successful discharge of two Taser 7 cartridges into a target
Completion of hands-on drills with Certified Taser instructor.
Optional Taser Exposure. If the student participates, there will be video documentation.

191d0d5d-398a-4a2f-8722-0b47806cfc63.description: This course is designed to allow students to earn a one-year renewable user-certification in the use of the Taser X2 device. This course emphasizes both proficiency and decision-making in the use of the Taser X2 device as well as the current legalities of the use of this device. This course meets all requirements set forth by Axon. This course is part of the curriculum for CRJ5484 Criminal Justice Internship I.
191d0d5d-398a-4a2f-8722-0b47806cfc63.name: Taser X2 Certification (8 Hours)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 8- hour Axon Taser classroom course
Completion of Basic Taser user course written exam with a minimum score of 90%
Completion of Taser 7 written exam with a minimum score of 90%
Successful discharge of two Taser 7 cartridges into a target
Completion of hands-on drills with Certified Taser instructor
Optional Taser Exposure. If the student participates there will be video documentation

ff8bff66-401f-43dd-89b6-96fd4442655c.description: This credential is designed to recognize a student that has successfully completed the first year of the student patrol program at Cowley College in good standing.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete CRJ 5482 Criminal Justice Topics I
Complete CRJ 5483 Criminal Justice Topics II
Complete a minimum of 75 hours of uniformed patrol work
Complete a graded scenario with a minimum score of 70% or higher
Maintained over 150 professional points in each course.
Complete Use of Force Aware Credential
Complete ASP Baton Credential
Complete First Aid/CPR credential

skills.name: Correctly complete Standard State of Kansas Paperwork including a Kansas Evidence Custody Receipt

4e307a4c-61b2-4388-8d15-f7f22995d199.description: This course will introduce students to firearms and cover several areas concerning their use including up-to-date legal issues and case law, use of force considerations, and maintenance and care. The student will experience simulator-based training and complete range qualification. This badge will be earned through CRJ5495 Introduction to Firearms.
4e307a4c-61b2-4388-8d15-f7f22995d199.name: Firearms Basic (8-Weeks)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 8-week required course
Complete a minimum of four scenario-based situations making the correct assessment per course instructor.
Complete all course exams with a minimum of a 70%.
Complete a Kansas CPOST-approved qualification shoot with a 70% or higher score.

skills.name: Assess critical factors of a shooting situation
Complete a Kansas CPOST approved qualification
Identify relevant legal issues in a shooting situation

7d46154c-f3cf-4c21-973a-7dd87bf88fc1.description: The “Improving Your Online Course” workshop explores the QM Rubric and provides a framework to improve the quality of online courses. Participants use the QM Rubric to review their own online courses and develop a course improvement plan. The content is based on the essential Specific Review Standards of the Quality Matters Rubric. Participants come away with a plan for course improvement so enrolling in the workshop with a pre-developed online course is required.
7d46154c-f3cf-4c21-973a-7dd87bf88fc1.name: Quality Matters IYOC

badge_template_activities.title: Recognize the foundational concepts of Quality Matters.
Apply the essential Specific Review Standards of the Quality Matters Rubric to your own online course.
Describe the alignment of at least one module/unit in your online course.
Prioritize improvements to your online course.

e9a79bbe-2f5d-4a4a-979b-97623395fa41.description: This course is designed to instruct students on the art of handcuffing suspects. The course will cover use of force considerations, safety and have a practical component. This course will be part of the curriculum for CRJ5482 Criminal Justice Topics II.
e9a79bbe-2f5d-4a4a-979b-97623395fa41.name: Basic Handcuffing (4 Hours)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 4 hour- course
Demonstrate handcuffing a standing subject with appropriate verbal commands
Demonstrate handcuffing a prone subject with appropriate verbal commands
Complete written exam with minimum score of 80%

e3e3ab3f-7030-41f4-852a-342dea3e2214.description: This course is designed to educate students on current use of force laws and practices. The student will evaluate case law as well as use of force continuums. The student will become aware of how vital the ability to assess a situation is at the time you are in it and how to legally protect themselves as well as properly and ethically document use of force situations.
e3e3ab3f-7030-41f4-852a-342dea3e2214.name: Use of Force Aware (4 Hours)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 4 - hour course
Completion of written exam with 70% or higher score.
Recognize the case facts of Tennessee vs Garner
Demonstrate the ability to make proper decisions in use of force scenarios
List the only acceptable reasons for use of force according to the United States Supreme Court.

skills.name: Demonstrate competent decision-making decisions when analyzing situations.
Demonstrate knowledge of case law and legalities pertaining to use of force.
Differentiate between use of force and use of deadly force situations

8dd74ab0-0900-4339-a807-d7617be9bcdb.description: Cowley College sees the importance of having quality online instructors, at our institution. We are committed to offering training in Blackboard and Quality Matters.
8dd74ab0-0900-4339-a807-d7617be9bcdb.name: Cowley Online Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete online Blackboard training
Successfully complete Quality Matters APPQMR and/or 6th Edition Update
Complete QM self-assessment of one of their own online classes
Debrief with Online Team member on self-evaluation of course and changes to be verified.

eb8f52b8-b5f6-4b23-a324-d4a52c36e00a.description: Cowley Distance Learning - speakers from our own wonderful staff.

badge_template_activities.title: 1 Hour presentation going over the use of Rubrics and Discussions in Blackboard.

107c6bf5-0377-4ece-801a-f3c33bb10043.description: The Power Plant Technical Program utilizes online courses tailored to the needs of the operator and engine type. The program is broken up by quarters, consisting of approximately 240 total hours of instructional contact time, and is flexible to fit the busy operator schedule. KMU’s Power Plant Technology Program focuses on training workers who are new to the electrical generation industry as well as those currently working in the field wishing to increase their promotion potential.
107c6bf5-0377-4ece-801a-f3c33bb10043.name: Power Plant Technology Bronze Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Introduction to the Power Industry and Municipal Utilities • Common Sense Safety •Mechanical Fundamentals •Basic Math & Physics •Introduction to Power Plant Systems •Basic Electricity & Electronics •Basic Print Reading •Electrical Equipment •Pumps •Valves •Properties of Materials •Maintenance Scheduling & Work Practices •Combustion Theory •Heat Transfer and Fluid Flow •Combustion Turbine Module • Reciprocating Engine Module
Must successfully pass all exams and assignments at 80% or higher.

cff8688b-2662-41c5-a606-7c8cccd1b1a4.description: This course is designed to allow students to earn a lifetime certification in the ASP baton. The course is designed to incorporate sound decision-making into the ASP baton proficiency course. The course meets the standards set forth by ASP Inc. Armament Systems and Procedures. This course is part of the curriculum for CRJ5483 Criminal Justice Topics II.
cff8688b-2662-41c5-a606-7c8cccd1b1a4.name: ASP Baton Certification (Lifetime) (10hrs)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 8 Hour required ASP course
Completion of ASP baton written exam with 80% or higher.
Complete 2-hour hands-on proficiency and scenario training with the course instructor.

57824d49-39e7-4cdb-9318-38f241e226e5.description: The course is devised to give students a fundamental knowledge of the Eddy Current Testing Method Level I in the Nondestructive Testing Industry. Satisfactory completion  (70% or higher) of the Eddy Current Level I overall course grade.

0ced7736-1843-4f2f-b178-822e03704c08.description: The course is devised to give students an intermediate-level knowledge of the Eddy Current Testing Method Level II in the Nondestructive Testing Industry. 4dae3daf-40f1-423a-986a-020b3372290a.description: This badge will introduce students to automotive electrical systems and cover several areas concerning basic theory, diagnostic tools and testing, electronic theory and operation, anti-theft, instrument cluster and lighting systems, and electrical/electronic system fundamentals. This badge will be earned through AMS3117 and/or AMS3118
4dae3daf-40f1-423a-986a-020b3372290a.name: Automotive Technology - Electrical Systems

badge_template_activities.title: Complete online training components of course.
Complete all online course exams with a minimum of a 80%
34S11W0 Basic Electrical Theory and Operation (Duration 1hr 26 min)
34S13W0 Electrical Diag. Tools and Testing - Part I (Duration 2 hours)
34S14W0 Electrical Diag. Tools and Testing - Part II (Duration 1hr 33 min)
34S15W0 Electronic Theory and Operation (Duration 1hr 11 min)
34S21W1 Anti-Theft Systems (Duration 1hr 27 min)
34S30W0 Supplemental Restraint System Diagnosis (1hr 12 min)
34S31W0 Instrument Cluster and Lighting Systems (Duration 1hr 13 min)
F101011003 Electrical/Electronic System Fundamentals (1hr 18 min)

f49c610d-864d-40ff-819e-f1d385b5a96c.description: This course is designed to allow students to earn a one-year renewable user certification in the Controlled F.O.R.C.E curriculum. This course is designed to educate the student in a specialized form of self-defense and combat known as Controlled F.O.R.C.E. which utilizes five basic building block holds known as Mechanical Advantage Control Holds, or M.A.C.H.™ holds. This credential will be offered through CRJ5432 Controlled FORCE.
f49c610d-864d-40ff-819e-f1d385b5a96c.name: Control Force I (16 Weeks)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 16-Week Course
Completion of all written exams with a 70% or higher score
Demonstrate M.A.C.H holds one through five meeting instructor approval
Complete a mock scenario utilizing Controlled F.O.R.C.E. MACH holds
Properly demonstrate MACH holds in an escort capacity
Properly explain where Controlled F.O.R.C.E fits into the use of force continuum

skills.name: Demonstrate a proper take down and arrest using Controlled FORCE holds
Demonstrate the proper application of MACH holds one through five

2e729ada-b47b-44c0-bfad-449d035e57b2.description: This course is designed to allow students to earn a one-year renewable user-certification in the Controlled F.O.R.C.E curriculum. This course is designed to educate the student in a specialized form of self-defense and combat known as Controlled F.O.R.C.E. This course is designed to utilize the skills learned in Controlled FORCE I and apply them to scenario-based training. This credential will be offered through CRJ5433 Controlled FORCE II.
2e729ada-b47b-44c0-bfad-449d035e57b2.name: Control Force II (16 Weeks)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 16 Week Course
Completion of all written exams with a 70% or higher score
Incorporate the ASP baton into the MACH holds and use as appropriate per course instructor
Demonstrate proper weapon retention
Demonstrate appropriate defensive tactics while in a confrontation on the ground
Use MACH one holds during an aggressive attack
Demonstrate an ability to determine appropriate threat levels.

skills.name: Demonstrate a proper take down and arrest using Controlled FORCE holds
Demonstrate the proper application of MACH holds one through five

4ac732cc-4023-4e4c-bc9e-2d6ade6dbf1f.description: Cowley Leaders at Work is a leadership program for Cowley employees to develop team work and data utilization in action research to solve problems or improve processes of the College
4ac732cc-4023-4e4c-bc9e-2d6ade6dbf1f.name: Cowley Leadership at Work

badge_template_activities.title: 1.  Discover character strengths and use this knowledge in team building.
2.  Develop or enhance leadership skills within the work place.
3.  Demonstrate the use of quality improvement principles and tools to analyze and propose solutions to problems in the work place.
4.  Identify key measures for process improvement and utilize data within work areas.
5.  Identify a work-related problem and explore solutions using the information gained.
Guided by an Administrative Council representative, the badge earner developed and completed a  4 week project that addressed a work-related problem.

b726f314-660e-447c-a5b4-73e2145e2977.description: Cowley College sees the importance of accessibility in regards to digital files. Accessibility is about ensuring that every person has an equal opportunity to access the same information. Cowley College is committed to ensuring that our staff has the understanding and tools necessary to accomplish accessibility in digital files.
b726f314-660e-447c-a5b4-73e2145e2977.name: Digital Accessibility

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Word Accessibility Training
Attend Summer Symposium or WSU Tech Accessibility Bootcamp
Attend Powerpoint/Excel Accessibility Training
Attend Closed Captioning Accessibility Training
